nz.co.jedsimson.lgp.core.program.instructions

Class Operation<TData>

  • nz.co.jedsimson.lgp.core.program.instructions.Operation<TData>
  • Type Parameters:
    TData -

    Type of arguments that the operation operates on.

    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Module
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BinaryOperation, UnaryOperation

    public class Operation<TData>
implements Module

    A primitive that encapsulates the action of executing a function on a set of arguments.

    An operation is the composition of an interface Arity and some function that it can perform on class Arguments given to it.

    Operations are specified as interface Modules, meaning that custom operations can be implemented and use when generating instructions for an individual in the population.

    It is generally expected that operations will be loaded using an interface OperationLoader, but they could also be resolved using a class ModuleFactory, like other modules.

    Operations should have some representation associated with them, so that the action that they convey can be expressed in a textual form.

    See Also:
    interface Arity, class Arguments, interface Module, interface OperationLoader, class ModuleFactory

      • execute

        public TData execute(@NotNull
                     Arguments<TData> arguments)

        Executes an operation in some way.

        A base implementation is provided which:

        • Validates that the correct number of arguments is provided.

        • Applies function to the given arguments.

        This function is marked as open to allow extension if the base implementation does not provide the behaviour necessary for other use cases.

        Parameters:
        arguments - A set of arguments to the function.
        Returns:
        A concrete value of type TData.
        Throws:
        ArityException - When the number of arguments does not match the arity.
        See Also:
        function, arguments

      • toString

        @NotNull
public java.lang.String toString(@NotNull
                                          java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> operands,
                                          int destination)

        Provides a string representation of this operation.

        Parameters:
        operands - The registers used by the class Instruction that this class Operation belongs to.
        destination - The destination register of the class Instruction this class Operation belongs to.
        Returns:
        A string representation of this operation.
